entry.title: SAP Business One Hana FP2011, Web Browser
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

We are experiencing frequent crashes of the SAP Business One application.
We have limited the add-on to certain databases, but the problem persists and requires manual restarting of the Browser Access Gatekeeper service several times a day.
This intermittent problem is preventing us from working.
Please help.

entry.title: Question: When will my blog post become visible on SAP Community?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I submitted a blog post this past Sunday (October 5, 2025). As far as I know, blog posts on SAP Community go through a moderation process before being published.

How long does this usually take? My post hasn't been published yet.
Did I possibly miss something, or should I just wait a bit longer?

Thanks in advance üôè

entry.title: Questions on using Terraform with SAP BTP Trial Account
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am following the Discovery Center mission ‚ÄúImplement Observability in a Full-Stack CAP Application Following SAP BTP Developer‚Äôs Guide‚Äù and have a few questions regarding the optional section ‚ÄúSet up your subaccount in SAP BTP using Terraform provider for SAP BTP‚Äù.

A few weeks ago, I completed an introduction to Terraform and then did some hands-on practice setting up a Trial Account with developer tools. However, I got stuck on a few points, which I‚Äôve now encountered again, and would really appreciate some clarification.

Here‚Äôs my setup and questions:

  • I‚Äôm trying to set up a Trial BTP Account using Terraform
  • When creating the Cloud Foundry environment instance, it‚Äôs automatically created with Org Memory set to 0 MB, and I can‚Äôt modify it due to restrictions (as mentioned in a previous Q&A). Is this a trial account limitation, or am I missing something?
  • In the Discovery Center mission, the .tfvars file for step 1 requires a custom_idp URL. Starting from a (trial) global account without any existing subaccount, how can I obtain this information? When I do this manually in the trial subaccount, I subscribe to the Cloud Identity Services (default plan) and then establish a trust configuration.

Maybe I‚Äôm misunderstanding part of the setup, any insights or experience you can share would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance

entry.title: SAP Hana DB Triggers
entry.content:
Hello gurus, 

Does the .hdbtrigger provide details of what has been changed? And if yes how to access this?

Below is my trigger, and I want the "CONTEXT" to contain info on what has been changed

 
TRIGGER "TR_TB_COSTCENTERTEXT_CREATE"
  AFTER INSERT ON "TB_COSTCENTERTEXT"
  REFERENCING NEW ROW NewRow
  FOR EACH ROW
  BEGIN
   
    INSERT INTO TB_CHANGELOG
    (
      "ID",
      "SOURCETABLE",
      "SOURCE",
      "ACTION",
      "LOGTIME",
      "CONTEXT",
      "STATUS")
      VALUES
      (
        SYSUUID,
        'TB_COSTCENTERTEXT',
        :NewRow."source",
        'INSERT',
        NOW(),
        ---> <what was changed> <----,
        'NEW'
      );
  END;
 
Update: 
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/using-hana-database-triggers-to-capture-selected-column-updates/ba-p/13159575
I found this approach using "REFERENCING OLD ROW OldRow, NEW ROW NewRow" and then compare the columns 1 by 1.. But that is quit a big task when you have many columns to track.
Any smarter solution available?

entry.title: Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable in Product API error
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and trying to perform a POST operation using the Product (API_PRODUCT_2) API.
However, I‚Äôm receiving the following error response:

{
  "error": {
    "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
    "message": "Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable",
    "target": "_ProductPurchaseOrderText(Product='102010000009',TextObjectType='BEST',Language='EN')",
    "details": [
      {
        "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
        "message": "Entity PRODUCTPROCUREMENT is not maintainable",
        "target": "_ProductProcurement"
      },
      {
        "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
        "message": "Entity PRODUCTPLANTPROCUREMENT is not maintainable",
        "target": "_ProductPlant(Product='102010000009',Plant='CN7A')/_ProductPlantProcurement"
      }
    ],
    "innererror": {
      "ErrorDetails": {
        "@SAP__common.Application": {
          "ComponentId": "LO-MD-MM",
          "ServiceRepository": "SRVD_A2X",
          "ServiceId": "API_PRODUCT_2",
          "ServiceVersion": "0001"
        },
        "@SAP__common.TransactionId": "86545C3DDA130010E0068E7D20C1703B",
        "@SAP__common.Timestamp": "20251009154237.258522",
        "@SAP__common.ErrorResolution": {
          "Analysis": "Use ADT feed reader 'SAP Gateway Error Log' or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details",
          "Note": "See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

My Question:

  • Why are these entities (PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT, PRODUCTPROCUREMENT, PRODUCTPLANTPROCUREMENT) not maintainable through the post API?

  • Are there any restrictions in the Public Cloud Edition for maintaining these sub-entities via API?

  • Is there an alternative API or approach to update these product procurement or purchase order text details?

 

I‚Äôve already checked the payload structure and API reference documentation, and the JSON is valid. The base product entity is being read successfully ‚Äî the error occurs only during the POST operation.

Any insights or SAP Notes related to this behavior would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
Janarthanan R.

Thanks, Frank

entry.title: Development of client-facing app in SAP BTP - Authentication and User management
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on the development of an SAPUI5 application in SAP BTP using SAP Business Application Studio. The idea is that this application will be deployed using SAP Build Workzone, Standard edition. This application acts like a simple portal where a small subset of the company's customers (~5 customers, which themselves are also companies) will need to access from outsite the organization where the app will be hosted. Based on the logged in user, the portal will display data regarding to the business partner that user represents (this I believe a mapping between the user and the BP code in SAP is enough). The Odata service itself is not that complex (in the sense that will retrieve sales data for the customer, so it's pretty much an Odata service that will retrieve data from sales tables like VBAK, VBAP, etc. For context, I'm working with a on-premise ECC EHP7 backend. An high level diagram of the development is as below:

 

‚ÄÉ

As I am fairly new to BTP Identity solutions, I believe that the main point here is regarding the expositure of this app in SAP BTP for people outside the organization (third party access). One of the requirements is that the management of the credentials for these customers would be done entirely on my organization's side, for better control: we would not want anyone with access to the app to request an user account there.

There are a handful of possibilites, but i'd like to understand what would be the best approaches (or at least an combination of approaches). I thought of the following approaches:

1) try to manage the authentication with a developed user service - besides being less safe, I believe this is not possible due to the security layet BTP itself has, so you'd need to have a valid user to authenticate with BTP before accessing the portal.

2) Use SAP Identity Authentication Service (IAS alone), with its Local User Store and without both Self Service registration and Social Identity Providers - Users would be created by administrators, and the password sent to them, in a similar fashion to what's done with service keys for Integration Suite scenarios. Similar to the scenario in https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/business-to-business-scenario?locale=en-US, considering a single user per customer (or even https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/business-to-consumer-scenario?locale=en-US without the possibility of the user creating an access to themselves

3) Use SAP Cloud Identity Services (not only IAS) to manage the integration with the corporate identity provider of the organization i'm working (Microsoft Entra ID). I believe this can be more complex as we'd shift the control of the user maintenance to the organization's Identity Provider, so some sort of federation/trust would be required between SAP Cloud Identity Services and Entra ID.

 
This looks like a common (or at least, not very uncommon) scenario, so I would appreciate guidances or suggestions on the best path for this auth.
 
Thanks in Advance,
Erick Grilo.

entry.title: SAP BTP Trial Access Issue
entry.content:
No global account associated with my user after trial registration

 I want to subscribe and edit global quota for ABAP environment using SAP BTP which i am not able to do this and  its giving me the below error and also i am not able to see the below navigations :-

To edit the ABAP quota, log on to the SAP BTP cockpit as an administrator. Navigate to your global account and select Entitlements Entity Assignments. Enter the subaccount for the ABAP environment and choose Go. Click on Configure Entitlements, then select Add Service Plans. In the popup, choose the relevant service plans for the ABAP environment, such as abap_compute_unit and hana_compute_unit. Increase the quotas in the abap_compute_unit service plan by at least 1 and in the hana_compute_unit service plan by at least 2. Finally, save your changes.

entry.title: Connection Issue Between SAP BTP Trial and S/4HANA On-Premise via Cloud Connector
entry.content:
Hi All,

I‚Äôm currently configuring the connectivity between our SAP BTP free trial account and our S/4HANA on-premise system using the Cloud Connector. After completing the setup, I tried to validate the connection between the cloud and on-premise systems, but I encountered an error.

Upon checking the related SAP Note, it seems that the issue might be due to a possible spelling mistake in the host name or a connectivity issue with the internal host.

I have verified that the internal hostname and port are correct, and I also checked in SICF in on-premise system to ensure the correct internal host and port are maintained. However, the connection is still not working. I‚Äôm using an HTTPS connection.

Could you please help me resolve this issue?

BR/Kannan.

entry.title: Urgent: Unable to Access SAP Process Automation Project ‚Äì Deployment and Performance Issues
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm currently experiencing a serious issue with SAP Process Automation, and I would really appreciate any advice or help from the community.

Here‚Äôs what happened:

Yesterday, I tried to deploy a new version of my automation project. Out of around more than 10 deployment attempts, only 1 was successful.
When it finally deployed, the process execution became extremely slow ‚Äî it took about 40‚Äì50 minutes to complete (normally it only takes around 30‚Äì40 seconds).
Today, I cannot access my SAP Process Automation project at all. The system seems completely unavailable for me.

Additional information:
Everything was working perfectly just a few days ago.
I didn‚Äôt make any configuration or environment changes.

Has anyone else encountered similar issues recently?
Or does anyone know if there‚Äôs an ongoing incident affecting SAP Process Automation services?

Any guidance or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you so much in advance! 

SAP Workflow Management, process visibility capability  
SAP Build Process Automation  

SAP BTP ABAP environment  

SAP Workflow Management

entry.title: Code of S4hana public cloud Standart Fiori Apps to BTP
entry.content:
HI all, on Public cloud is there any way to download the code of Standart Fiori app?

From time to time we have requirements to create side-by-side developments that re-create some apps from Cloud on BTP with more functionalities. Sometimes easy way would be clone the app on BTP, and after perform necessary changes.

What is the easy way to do that on S4/hana Public cloud?
